name: Slim cotton-linen shirt in gingham
description: Before there were synthetic fabrics to battle the heat, there was cotton and linen. This lightweight textured fabric actually looks better with a few wrinkles—meaning it will still look great after that long client meeting on a hazy summer afternoon.

name: Slim indigo linen shirt in plaid
description: Before there were synthetic fabrics to battle the heat, there was linen. This lightweight textured fabric actually looks better with a few wrinkles—meaning it will still look great after that long client meeting on a hazy summer afternoon.

name: Slim linen shirt in wide stripe
description: Before there were synthetic fabrics to battle the heat, there was linen. This lightweight fabric actually looks better with a few wrinkles—meaning it will still look great after that long client meeting on a hazy summer afternoon.

name: Short-sleeve lightweight oxford shirt
description: Few shirts age better than an oxford. The frays, the fades—these are the kinds of details we love. We selected this fabric because it can (and will) hang with your old favorites.

name: Short-sleeve shirt in red floral print
description: Give the standard stripes and solids a day off and incorporate this floral pattern into your rotation.

name: Garment-dyed cotton oxford pant in 484 slim fit
description: Our slimmest fit yet, for guys who like their pants tailored, not skinny. This pair is cut in lightweight cotton oxford, one of our favorite fabrics for warmer weather. We wash each pair for over 300 minutes for that perfect broken-in feel (so it's as if you've had them forever from day one), then dust them with pigment to achieve a rich, saturated color.

name: Essential chino pant in 1040 athletic fit
description: We make our clean-cut chinos from crisp two-ply cotton twill, then wash them lightly so they're laid-back but still refined.

name: Bowery slim pant in stretch chino
description: A perfectly tailored, slightly slimmer version of our classic Bowery fit (first launched in 2009), this pant is cut in a chino fabric with a small bit of added flex. Ideal for the guy who rides a bike or walks to work, these pants are more comfortable, thanks to that extra elasticity.

name: Short-sleeve camp-collar shirt in rabbit print
description: This shirt is designed with an old-school camp collar, which is meant to be worn unbuttoned without a tie. Woven with slightly less refined yarns than your standard button-down, it has a relaxed, rustic feel that's perfect for warm-weather days.

name: Slim délavé Irish linen shirt
description: Our linen comes from Baird McNutt in Ireland (Irish linen is considered to be the world's finest, and Baird McNutt's the finest in Ireland). This particular linen is put through a special dye-and-wash process that gives it a slightly faded look and feel; called délavé, the fabric is considered one of the world's best. And due to the nature of the process that makes it so special, the fabric used for each shirt will have its own unique color and characteristics—so no two will be exactly alike.

name: Onitsuka Tiger Colorado Eighty-Five® sneakers
description: Founded by Kihachiro Onitsuka in 1949, Onitsuka Tiger is one of the world's first sneaker brands and an early running-shoe innovator. Kihachiro used the Latin motto Anima Sana In Corpore Sano—or "a sound mind in a sound body"—to describe his design philosophy, later rebranding the company with its initials, Asics. Revived in 2001 as Asics's heritage line, Onitsuka Tiger lives on today in reissues of the brand's most successful designs from the last 60 years, including the Colorado Eighty-Five. Collaborating with Onitsuka Tiger in celebration of the 30th anniversary of the style, our designers came up with exclusive colors that you'll only find here.

name: Indian madras shirt in dark guava
description: The name for madras comes from the Indian city of Madraspatnam (now known as Chennai), home to some of the best of the classic cloth since the 17th century. For these shirts, we went to the country that invented the extra-light, comfortable fabric to create one-of-a-kind plaids you won't find anywhere else.

name: Short-sleeve shirt in heather poplin blue gingham
description: This is the shirt every guy needs in his arsenal, in a classic gingham pattern. We used heathered yarns (created by twisting different threads together, resulting in added flecks of color) to give this shirt a unique look.

name: Slim short-sleeve lightweight oxford in pink plaid
description: Few shirts age better than an oxford, in terms of both the fabric and the style. This one's lightweight, looser weave works particularly well during heat waves.

name: Secret Wash short-sleeve shirt in vintage navy gingham
description: Give the stripes and solids a day off and incorporate some prints into your rotation with a gingham shirt. This one is exceptionally soft, thanks to our top-secret multistep wash process. (If we told you what it was, it wouldn't be a secret. Sorry.)

name: Seersucker shirt
description: This shirt is made from seersucker, a warm-weather puckered fabric that takes its name from the Persian phrase shîr-o-shakar ("milk and sugar"), which describes its alternating smooth and textured stripes. This is your go-to shirt for keeping (and looking) cool when the temperatures aren't anymore.

name: Seersucker shirt in fine stripe
description: This shirt is made from seersucker, a warm-weather puckered fabric that takes its name from the Persian phrase shîr-o-shakar ("milk and sugar"), which describes its alternating smooth and textured stripes. This is your go-to shirt for keeping (and looking) cool when the temperatures aren't anymore.

name: Slim end-on-end cotton-linen shirt in plaid
description: Before there were synthetic fabrics to battle the heat, there was cotton and linen. This lightweight textured fabric actually looks better with a few wrinkles—meaning it will still look great after that long client meeting on a hazy summer afternoon.

name: Chambray stretch chino pant in 484 slim fit
description: These chinos are cut in our slim 484 fit and made out of a chambray chino with a small bit of added flex. Ideal for the guy who rides a bike or walks a bunch, these pants are more comfortable thanks to that extra elasticity.

name: Lightweight garment-dyed stretch chino pant in slim fit
description: These chinos are cut in our slim 484 fit and made of the same fabric we use for our other chinos, just with a small bit of added flex. Ideal for the guy who rides a bike or walks a bunch, these pants are more comfortable thanks to that extra elasticity. We also wash each pair for over 300 minutes for that perfect broken-in feel (so it's as if you've had them forever from day one), then dust them with pigment to achieve a rich, saturated color.

name: Cotton-linen chino pant in 484 slim fit
description: Our slimmest fit yet, for guys who like their chinos slim, not skinny. Made with a cotton-linen blend, this pair of pants is perfect for a comfortable, put-together look in warmer temps.

name: Broken-in chino pant in straight fit
description: The chinos for the guy who's looking for a slim fit that's actually easy to move (and sit) in. First launched in 2003, our broken-in chinos are made from heavily washed cotton twill that give them a vintage look with the timeworn characteristics of a well-aged pair of jeans.

name: Irish linen chino pant in straight fit
description: The chinos for the guy who's looking for a fit that's actually easy to move (and sit) in. Made with linen from Baird McNutt in Ireland (Irish linen is considered to be the world's finest, and Baird McNutt's the finest in Ireland), this pair of pants is perfect for a comfortable, put-together look in warmer temps.

name: Ludlow tuxedo pant in Italian wool
description: This Ludlow tuxedo pant (a staple of our collection since 2008) is crafted in luxurious wool from Lanificio di Tollegno (est. 1862), one of the oldest mills in Italy and one of the last to still spin its own yarns.

name: Ludlow suit pant in gingham linen-cotton
description: Timeless, versatile and seriously stylish, the Ludlow pant (a staple of our collection since 2008) will quickly become the foundation of your suiting wardrobe. Perfect for when a bold tie isn't enough, this suit pant comes in a gingham linen-cotton fabric that's a classic choice for high style in higher temps.

name: Adidas® Stan Smith™ sneakers
description: One of the best-selling tennis shoes of all time is one of the hardest to find, but you can now get it here. This reintroduction of the iconic sneaker from the '70s, named after the world-champion tennis player, is 100 percent true to the original (because truly great designs can't be improved). These sneakers are made from full-grain leather and finished with Adidas's signature perforations for ventilation—so they're really cool. Literally.

name: Adidas® Stan Smith™ Primeknit sneakers
description: It may be 45 years since Stan Smith won his biggest singles titles, but he's still the reigning champ of the clean white court shoe. This version of the classic Adidas style has been updated with a modern twist—an upper made from the brand's Primeknit fabric—giving them a flexible, enhanced fit and even more breathability than the old-school Stans.

name: Onitsuka Tiger GSM™ sneakers
description: Founded by Kihachiro Onitsuka in 1949, Onitsuka Tiger is one of the world's first sneaker brands and an early running-shoe innovator. Kihachiro used the Latin motto "Anima Sana In Corpore Sano"—or "a sound mind in a sound body"—to describe his design philosophy, later rebranding the company with its initials, ASICS. Revived in 2001 as ASICS's heritage line, Onitsuka Tiger lives on today in reissues of the brand's most successful designs from the last 60 years, including the GSM, a sneaker that pays tribute to tennis styles from the '80s. It's available here in colors exclusive to only us.

name: Adidas® Gazelle® sneakers
description: The favorite sneaker of everyone from hip-hop giants to British rockers to American pop stars, the Adidas Gazelle first dropped in 1966 as a true athletic shoe. Over the next couple decades, Adidas continued to update the sneaker for better performance and style, securing a permanent place for it in the sneaker hall of fame. This version pays homage to the legendary version that came out in 1991, with the same materials, colors and proportions as the original, along with the iconic three-stripe design.

name: Adidas® Samba® sneakers
description: First introduced as a cold-weather soccer shoe in 1950 (the innovative gum sole provided great traction on frozen surfaces), the iconic Samba was adopted by everyone from skaters to rappers and became one of Adidas's best-selling sneakers. We're carrying it for the first time ever in a version that has a shorter tongue than the original, making it perfect for life when you're not on the turf.

name: New Balance® 247 classic sneakers
description: New Balance started making shoes in the U.S. over 75 years ago, and they're now famous for kicks that combine fashion and function—just ask any true sneakerhead. The 247 is a brand-new model that nods to the iconic Boston brand's history by combining elements from several of its classic sneakers. This iteration is built for guys who live life on the move—supercomfortable with a great fit, it'll look just as good at post-work drinks as it will on casual Saturday mornings. Like the name implies, these are shoes you'll want to wear all day, every day.

name: Vans® washed canvas authentic sneakers
description: Founded by Paul Van Doren in 1966, Vans has defined the footwear street culture of Southern California for decades. In this exclusive collaboration, we partnered with the company to recreate its famous lace-up sneakers to our exact specifications. Designed with custom colors, they're washed for a vintage look and accented with hiking-boot laces for one-of-a-kind shoes that are only available here.

name: Vans® Sk8-Hi sneakers
description: Founded by Paul and James Van Doren in 1966, Vans has defined Southern California's footwear street culture for decades. For this pair, Vans went to its archives, pulled a style from the Dogtown days and made a few tweaks to modernize it. The result? A shoe that's built to take all the kickflips and grinds a skater would put it through but that's sharp enough to wear to happy hour.

name: Ludlow cap-toe bluchers
description: The Ludlow shoe is our version of a bench-made dress shoe, and it's constructed using many of the same methods the world's best shoemakers use. We selected some of the finest leathers from tanneries in Italy and built these shoes with American-made soles and a Goodyear welt, which means you can resole them again and again—so they'll last a lifetime.

name: Kenton crepe-sole bucks
description: We updated our famous suede Kenton shoes with crepe soles inspired by the desert boots British WWII soldiers wore in North Africa. These bucks effortlessly span dapper and durable: The classic silhouette is recast slightly slimmer for a more modern feel (because why should your apparel be sleek but your shoes clunky?) and finished with a genuine Goodyear-welt construction, ensuring years and years of wear.

name: Adidas® slide sandals
description: Adidas has been making some of the world's greatest performance athletic shoes since 1949, but the brand is also known for its classic slide sandals, which are meant for doing absolutely nothing. Still bearing the iconic three-stripe Adidas design, these sandals are perfect for lounging poolside after a basketball match or soccer scrimmage.

name: Tidal New York® flip-flops
description: You could get shower sandals from the drug store, or you could get American-made flip-flops from Tidal New York, a company that's committed to hiring veterans and that donates a portion of each sale to the Heroes in Transition foundation. The flip-flops are made from 100 percent domestically sourced materials, are engineered for the perfect fit and are available here in three exclusive colors. If you ask us, the choice is pretty easy.

name: Birkenstock® Arizona sandals
description: You might say Birkenstock goes way back: The brand's original contoured footbed was created in Germany by Konrad Birkenstock in 1897. Today, each sandal is still made in Germany with a resilient cork and latex footbed that actually molds itself to your foot. So the more you wear them, the more comfortable they become.

name: Frankie sunglasses
description: We wanted our new sunglasses to be really special, so we gave them details like custom-created colors, superstrong hinges and UV-protected lenses. The Frankie takes inspiration from the round '60s frames old Hollywood's leading men used to wear. If you are shipping this item to California, please click here for Proposition 65 warning.

name: Syd sunglasses
description: We wanted our new sunglasses to be really special, so we gave them details like custom-created colors, superstrong hinges and UV-protected lenses. This one is based on the slim frames of the '60s, with a name that's a little classic, a little rebellious.

name: Jack sunglasses
description: Introducing sunglasses by your truly... Frames with character traits you'd look for in a friend—they boost your confidence, know how to make you look good and help you see the bright side of life. This style, our take on the classic aviator, features special details like custom-colored metals, superstrong hinges and UV-protected lenses. What more could you ask for from your new pair of shades? (Not much.)

name: Buffalo Bisons ball cap
description: Ebbets Field Flannels is known for its faithful reproductions of vintage baseball paraphernalia—each historical team logo is carefully researched and authenticated by the experts and aficionados at Ebbets before being applied to the cap. This one features the emblem of the Buffalo Bisons. Founded in 1878, the first incarnation of the Buffalo Bisons—based in Buffalo, NY— played in the International League from 1918 to 1970.

name: Kansas City Packers ball cap
description: Ebbets Field Flannels is known for its faithful reproductions of vintage baseball paraphernalia—each historical team logo is carefully researched and authenticated by the experts and aficionados at Ebbets before being applied to the cap. This one features the emblem of the Kansas City Packers. Kansas City played in the Federal League—a major league in 1914 and 1915 and the last time a challenge to the hegemony of the American and National leagues was successful.

name: Dayton Ducks ball cap
description: Ebbets Field Flannels is known for its faithful reproductions of vintage baseball paraphernalia—each historical team logo is carefully researched and authenticated by the experts and aficionados at Ebbets before being applied to the cap. This one features the emblem of the Dayton Ducks. Named after their owner and manager, Ducky Holmes, the Ducks played in the Middle Atlantic League and were affiliated with the Brooklyn Dodgers.

name: Panama hat with navy band
description: From Mark Twain to FDR, the most well-dressed men have borrowed one of Central America's warm-weather staples: the panama hat. Made using the finest strands of natural toquilla straw, each one is truly unique.

name: Garment-dyed ball cap
description: Made in LA and garment-dyed for highs and lows of color at the seams, this hat is as essential to spring and summer as a cold drink on the back porch.

name: Buffalo Bisons T-shirt
description: Ebbets Field Flannels is known for its faithful reproductions of vintage sports paraphernalia—each team logo is carefully researched and authenticated by the experts and aficionados at Ebbets before being applied to the shirt. Made in Los Angeles, this shirt is based on a jersey from the Buffalo Bisons' archives. Founded in 1878, the Buffalo Bisons—based in Buffalo, New York—played in the International League from 1918 to 1970.

name: Mohawk Giants T-shirt
description: Ebbets Field Flannels is known for its faithful reproductions of vintage sports paraphernalia—each team logo is carefully researched and authenticated by the experts and aficionados at Ebbets before being applied to the shirt. Made in Los Angeles, this shirt is based on a jersey from the Mohawk Giants' archives. Based in Schenectady, NY, the Giants were one of baseball's great independent black teams and played from 1913 to 1940.

name: Osaka Tigers T-shirt
description: Ebbets Field Flannels is known for its faithful reproductions of vintage sports paraphernalia—each team logo is carefully researched and authenticated by the experts and aficionados at Ebbets before being applied to the shirt. Made in Los Angeles, this shirt is based on a jersey from the Osaka Tigers' archives. Formed in 1936, the Osaka Tigers are one of Japan's earliest professional teams. The Tigers are known for the fierce loyalty of their fans and for their iconic Koshien Stadium, with its all-dirt infield.

name: Garment-dyed T-shirt
description: We're pretty proud of these T-shirts—they're made in LA from garment-dyed cotton, which means each one will have a perfectly imperfect color and will softly fade over time, capturing the laid-back lifestyle of their California roots (where a T-shirt is practically a daily uniform).

name: Broken-in T-shirt
description: Specially washed for softness and a broken-in appearance, this T-shirt (that's been part of our line since 2004) looks and feels like the well-worn favorite you had in college.

name: Broken-in V-neck T-shirt
description: Specially washed for softness and a broken-in appearance, this T-shirt (that's been part of our line since 2004) looks and feels like the well-worn favorite you had in college.

name: Slub cotton deck-striped T-shirt
description: Featuring a bold nautical stripe, our insanely soft slub cotton T-shirt seems destined for instant classic status. (Trust us, you'll wear it 24/7.)

name: Cotton T-shirt in microstripe
description: A wear-with-anything T-shirt made from textured, open-ended cotton. Our condolences to the rest of your T-shirts—we doubt you'll be wearing them much anymore.

name: Garment-dyed T-shirt in stripe
description: We're pretty proud of these T-shirts—they're made in LA from garment-dyed cotton, which means each one will have a perfectly imperfect color and will softly fade over time, capturing the laid-back lifestyle of their California roots (where a T-shirt is practically a daily uniform).

name: Short-sleeve anchor T-shirt in circular knitted jersey
description: Based off a vintage military-issue style, this unique T-shirt is knit without side seams. It also comes in a more classic, non-tailored fit than our other T-shirts. As a bonus, we added a pocket with a printed Wallace & Barnes anchor insignia.

name: Wells Beach graphic T-shirt
description: The graphic on this T-shirt depicts Wells Beach in Maine, a popular summer vacation spot. Coincidentally, this shirt is perfect for wearing at the beach (or just around town too).

name: Garment-dyed ship's gear T-shirt
description: We're pretty proud of these T-shirts—they're made in LA from garment-dyed cotton, which means each one will have a perfectly imperfect color and will softly fade over time, capturing the laid-back lifestyle of their California roots (where a T-shirt is practically a daily uniform).

name: Broken-in pocket polo shirt
description: Specially washed for softness and a broken-in appearance, this polo looks and feels like the well-worn favorite you had in college.

name: Sun-faded classic polo shirt
description: This classic polo is a clean-cut standard that goes with just about anything.

name: Textured cotton tipped polo shirt
description: There's something timeless and effortlessly cool about polo shirts from the '60s and '70s. This version is made from soft textured cotton and finished with vintage-inspired tipping, so you'll look just as cool as the guys who wore them back in the day.

name: Classic piqué polo shirt in stripe
description: This classic polo is a clean-cut standard that goes with just about anything.

name: Braided cotton belt
description: Inspired by the styles seen around the harbor, this braided belt is for the guy hoping to nail the look of someone who knows his port from his starboard.

name: Braided cotton belt
description: Inspired by classic nautical styles, this braided belt is for the guy who wants to nail the look of someone who knows his port from his starboard.

name: Braided web belt
description: Inspired by styles seen around the harbor, this braided belt is for the guy hoping to nail the look of someone who knows his port from his starboard.

name: Leather belt
description: Painstakingly crafted right here in the USA, it's the piece that pulls together every outfit.

name: Billykirk® leather belt
description: Founded in 1999 by the Bray brothers, Billykirk creates ruggedly minimalist leather goods that are some of the handsomest we've seen. Each one of their styles is made by hand in the heart of Amish country using antique tools and master-craftsman techniques. Constructed in vegetable-tanned leather from one of America's oldest and most renowned tanneries, Wickett & Craig, this leather belt is the one you'll have for years that only gets better with age.

name: Auster arrowhead belt
description: Crafted right here in the USA, our classic leather belt breaks in nicely and only gets better with age.

name: Leather dress belt
description: This handsome dress belt is the sleek option that goes with your fine suit and pressed chinos on the days when your everyday belt and denim take some time off.

name: Silk tie in embroidered sailboats
description: Sometimes you want to wear a tie even when you don't have to. This one is made from silk with an embroidered sailboat pattern. Fun fact: It's handmade in NYC's Long Island City.

name: Silk-linen tie in stripe
description: Sometimes you want to wear a tie even when you don't have to. This one is made from silk and linen in a classic striped pattern. Fun fact: It's handmade in NYC's Long Island City.

name: English silk tie in elephant floral print
description: Sometimes you want to wear a tie even when you don't have to. This one is made from English silk and features a unique elephant print. Fun fact: It's handmade in New York City's Long Island City.

name: Italian silk tie in blue plaid
description: Sometimes you want to wear a tie even when you don't have to. This one is made from Italian silk in a classic plaid pattern. Fun fact: It's handmade in New York City's Long Island City.

name: Silk tie in navy floral jacquard
description: Sometimes you want to wear a tie even when you don't have to. This one is made from silk in a floral jacquard pattern. Fun fact: It's handmade in NYC's Long Island City.

name: Silk-linen tie in thin stripe
description: Sometimes you want to wear a tie even when you don't have to. This one is made from a blend of silk and linen in a classic striped pattern that instantly elevates just about anything you wear with it. Fun fact: It's handmade in New York City's Long Island City.

name: Irish linen-cotton tie in solid
description: Sometimes you want to wear a tie even when you don't have to. This one is made from a linen-cotton blend produced by Baird McNutt, an iconic Irish mill that's been around for over a century. Fun fact: The tie is handmade in New York City's Long Island City.

name: Cotton-linen bow tie in anchor print
description: A bow tie is a classic way to set yourself apart from the crowd. Plus, it won't dangle in your soup. This one is made from cotton and linen in a classic anchor pattern that instantly elevates just about anything you wear with it. Fun fact: It's handmade in New York City's Long Island City.

name: American wool bow tie
description: This dapper bow tie is made with fabric from the American Woolen Company in Stafford Springs, Connecticut, which has woven textiles for some of the finest Italian mills. Fun fact: The tie is handmade in New York City's Long Island City.

name: Unstructured Ludlow blazer in stretch cotton
description: When we set out to make our unstructured Ludlow—our lightest ever—we wanted it to look like a blazer but feel like a T-shirt. To that end, we partnered with Somelos, an expert mill in Portugal (a country that's no stranger to sun-filled days), to weave an incredibly breathable cotton fabric. Then we cut it in our famous slim Ludlow silhouette without any of the usual canvasing or padding you'd find in a suit. It's the most versatile jacket a guy can own—from business casual to a weekend away. As an added bonus, it has a bit of stretch, which makes it more comfortable when you're running for the train or just sitting down with clients.

name: Ludlow unstructured cotton-linen blazer
description: When we set out to make our new unstructured Ludlow—our lightest ever—we wanted it to look like a blazer but feel like a T-shirt. To that end, we partnered with Somelos, an expert mill in Portugal (a country that's no stranger to sun-filled days), to weave an incredibly breathable cotton-linen fabric, then we cut it in our famous slim Ludlow silhouette without any of the usual canvasing or padding you'd find in a suit. Consider this blazer your new best friend this summer, whether you're lounging at the cabana or only dreaming about it.

name: Unstructured Ludlow blazer in cotton-linen
description: When we set out to make our unstructured Ludlow—our lightest ever—we wanted it to look like a blazer but feel like a T-shirt. To that end, we partnered with Somelos, an expert mill in Portugal (a country that's no stranger to sun-filled days), to weave an incredibly breathable cotton-linen fabric. Then we cut it in our famous slim Ludlow silhouette without any of the usual canvasing or padding you'd find in a suit. It's the most versatile jacket a guy can own—from business casual to a weekend away.

name: Unstructured Ludlow cotton-linen blazer
description: When we set out to make our unstructured Ludlow—our lightest ever—we wanted it to look like a blazer but feel like a T-shirt. To that end, we partnered with Somelos, an expert mill in Portugal (a country that's no stranger to sun-filled days), to weave an incredibly breathable cotton-linen fabric, then we cut it in our famous slim Ludlow silhouette without any of the usual canvasing or padding you'd find in a suit. It's the most versatile jacket a guy can own—from business casual to a weekend away.

name: Crosby blazer in Italian cotton
description: Our Crosby blazer is tailored with the athletic guy in mind, because while 18" biceps are hard to come by, a blazer that fits them shouldn't be. We added extra room in the chest, shoulders and sleeves but kept the quality construction and timeless design we're famous for. Perfect for warmer weather, this blazer (made from cotton fabric from the Larusmiani mill in Milan, Italy) is how you lighten up your tailored looks without sacrificing any style.

name: Ludlow blazer in Italian cashmere
description: Our famous Ludlow blazer that we first launched back in 2008, now in a new, lightweight cashmere from Italy's Lanificio di Tollegno mill. This is the jacket you'll wear for decades, not seasons. Some of the carefully constructed finishing touches you'll find include interior contrast pickstitching and contrast suiting-fabric trim at the welts—they're not details you can see from the outside, but we think they make all the difference.

name: Ludlow wide-lapel suit jacket in Japanese seersucker
description: Our famous Ludlow cut has been the cornerstone of our suiting since its introduction in 2008, but we wanted to add a bit of swagger by giving this version a new lapel that's an inch wider than our usual suit jackets. This jacket is made from seersucker (from the Three Looms mill in Japan), a warm-weather puckered fabric that takes its name from the Persian phrase shîr-o-shakar ("milk and sugar"), which describes its alternating smooth and textured stripes.

name: Ludlow suit jacket in Italian stretch chino
description: Timeless, versatile and seriously stylish, the Ludlow will quickly become the foundation of your suiting wardrobe—and we've given this jacket an awesome update. Made in cotton chino from Italy's famed Larusmiani mill, it has a bit of stretch, which makes it more comfortable when you're running for the train or just sitting down with clients. It's definitive proof that suiting up doesn't have to feel stuffy.

name: Ludlow suit jacket in gingham linen-cotton
description: Timeless, versatile and seriously stylish, the Ludlow (a staple of our collection since 2008) will quickly become the foundation of your suiting wardrobe. Perfect for when a bold tie isn't enough, this suit jacket comes in a gingham linen-cotton fabric that's a classic choice for high style in higher temps.

name: Ludlow shirt in end-on-end cotton
description: Introducing the perfect shirt for the perfect suit. Featuring a trim, tailored fit, this shirt was specifically created by our design team with the proportions of the Ludlow suit in mind. Crafted in two-ply 120s cotton—a fine weave with natural lustre and a luxurious handfeel—it's finished with bespoke-inspired touches like a split back yoke (a made-to-measure detail that ensures a clean drape) and darts at both shoulders for a streamlined silhouette.

name: Ludlow shirt in striped end-on-end cotton
description: The perfect shirt for the perfect suit. Featuring a trim, tailored fit, this shirt was specifically created by our design team with the proportions of the Ludlow suit in mind. Crafted in two-ply 120s cotton—a fine weave with natural lustre and a luxurious handfeel—it's finished with bespoke-inspired touches like a split-back yoke (a made-to-measure detail that ensures a clean drape) and darts at both shoulders for a streamlined silhouette.

name: Ludlow spread-collar shirt
description: Introducing the perfect shirt for the perfect suit. Featuring a trim, tailored fit, this shirt was specifically created by our design team with the proportions of the Ludlow suit in mind. Crafted in two-ply 120s cotton—a fine weave with natural lustre and a luxurious handfeel—it's finished with bespoke-inspired touches like a split back yoke (a made-to-measure detail that ensures a clean drape) and darts at both shoulders for a streamlined silhouette.

name: Ludlow pleated tuxedo shirt
description: Introducing the Ludlow tuxedo shirt, the perfect shirt for all your formal events. Featuring a trim, tailored fit, it was specifically created by our design team with the proportions of the Ludlow tuxedo in mind. It's crafted in 120s cotton (a fine weave with a noticeably luxurious handfeel) and finished with a pleated front bib that takes cues from classic tux styles.

name: Crosby oxford shirt
description: The Crosby shirt is designed with an athletic build in mind. Even better, this one is made from cotton oxford, a fabric that only gets better with age (meaning you'll be enviably well dressed for a long time to come). The Crosby is cut with wider arms and a bigger body because we believe that while 18" biceps might be hard to come by, a great dress shirt shouldn't be.

name: Crosby shirt in blue stripe
description: The Crosby shirt is designed with an athletic build in mind. Like our other dress shirts, it's woven with 120s threads by some of the best mills in the world—only the Crosby is cut with wider arms and a bigger body because we believe that while 18" biceps might be hard to come by, a great dress shirt shouldn't be.

name: Crosby shirt in plaid
description: The Crosby shirt is designed with an athletic build in mind. Like our other dress shirts, it's made from two-ply 120s cotton from some of the best mills in the world. Only the Crosby is cut with wider arms and a bigger body, because we believe that while 18" biceps might be hard to come by, a great dress shirt shouldn't be.

name: Crosby shirt in laurel green check
description: The Crosby shirt is designed with an athletic build in mind. Like our other dress shirts, it's made from two-ply 120s cotton from some of the best mills in the world. Only the Crosby is cut with wider arms and a bigger body, because we believe that while 18" biceps might be hard to come by, a great dress shirt shouldn't be.

name: 484 slim jean in Collins wash
description: Our slimmest fit yet, for guys who like their jeans slim, not skinny. This wash—specially designed by hand at Wonderland Concepts in Henderson, Kentucky—is made to look like a pair of rigid jeans after about six months of wear, which is great if you're not into the whole "breaking in denim yourself" thing.

name: 770 straight jean in Riverton wash
description: Our 770 jeans are more narrow than our 1040 slim-straight but not as skinny as the 484 (our slimmest fit). For our denim fabric we went to the Kaihara mill, one of Japan's oldest and most renowned denim producers. This wash replicates a once-washed pair, which is great for the guy who likes the dark denim look but not the whole idea of rigid jeans.

name: 770 straight jean in Sutton wash
description: Our 770 jeans are more narrow than our 1040 slim-straight but not as skinny as the 484 (our slimmest fit). This wash—specially designed by hand at Wonderland Concepts in Henderson, Kentucky—is made to replicate the heavy fading that occurs with about two years of frequent use, which is nice because you get the worn look without the bagginess that usually comes with that much wear.

name: 1040 athletic jean in Cheshire wash
description: Formerly known as the slim-straight, the 1040 fit is for guys who like their jeans cut with a classic, straight fit that's always in style. For our denim fabric we went to the Kaihara mill, one of Japan's oldest and most renowned denim producers. Our washes are specially designed at Wonderland Concepts in Henderson, Kentucky, where every pair is hand-distressed for an authentic look. This wash is made to look like a pair of rigid jeans after about six months of wear, which is great if you're not into the whole "breaking in denim yourself" thing.

name: 1040 athletic selvedge jean in Fairfax wash
description: Formerly known as the slim-straight, the 1040 fit is for guys who like their jeans cut with a classic, straight fit that's always in style. This pair is made from authentic selvedge cotton denim woven on 100-year-old narrow looms at the Kaihara mill, one of Japan's oldest and most renowned denim producers and is lightly rinsed for a softer feel than our rigid denim. How can you tell it's true selvedge? Turn up the cuffs and you'll see the signature stitching.
